title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
PART i

1 point is earned: For a gravitational force with correct direction and label

1 point is earned: For a tension force with correct direction and label

Note: A maximum of one point may be earned if there are any extraneous forces.

PART ii

1 point is earned: For a vector pointing downward representing the gravitational force with no extraneous forces

Note: A label is not required, since the use of labels is assessed in part (b)(i).

PART iii

1 point is earned: For attempting to find the horizontal component of velocity

Note: See examples below. This point is earned for the wrong use of trig functions if it is clear it is being used to find the horizontal component, but not awarded if it’s not clear which component the trig function is referring to, or for stating that the vertical component is zero.

1 point is earned: For a correct numerical answer for horizontal velocity with correct units

Student response earns 5 of the following 5 point(s)

PART i

1 point is earned: For a gravitational force with correct direction and label

1 point is earned: For a tension force with correct direction and label

Note: A maximum of one point may be earned if there are any extraneous forces.

PART ii

1 point is earned: For a vector pointing downward representing the gravitational force with no extraneous forces

Note: A label is not required, since the use of labels is assessed in part (b)(i).

PART iii

1 point is earned: For attempting to find the horizontal component of velocity

Note: See examples below. This point is earned for the wrong use of trig functions if it is clear it is being used to find the horizontal component, but not awarded if it’s not clear which component the trig function is referring to, or for stating that the vertical component is zero.

1 point is earned: For a correct numerical answer for horizontal velocity with correct units
